alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Orange and north central Osceola Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hunters Creek, or over Kissimmee. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kissimmee, Buena Ventura Lakes, Celebration, Yeehaw Junction, and Hunters Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
